review_content: I use Community Coffee and Chicory because I enjoy a strong, dark brew and now I can get that in a cold brewer, albeit concentrated.The device is easy to use and clean, only takes 24 hours to brew the coffee like I like it and I can drink half cups of the concentrate for a week or more.Everything I was hoping for in addition to eliminating the electricity used and humidity created by hot brewing coffee.  I'm from/line in La. so additional heat and humidity  are bad Juju in a house down here.I always loved the PJ's cold brew coffee provided in the WWOZ Jazz Fest tent and now I can make my own!
title: Much better than my first device for brewing coldbrew coffee.

author: Crystal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021
review_content: I got this as a present for someone who drinks black coffee only and wanted an easy way to make cold brew at home. I have no serious complaints about this product and really wish I couldve given it 4.5/5 stars vs the 4 you see here. I really only took .5 a star away due to the fact that the lining on the middle filter peice is super thin and you have to be very gentle with it. Also, when you fill the middle peice with coffee, if you dont get the coffee wet before submerging it, it will overflow when you try to put the middle peice into the jug. Other than that, it works really well. Its suggested you put it in the fridge on the side and it has never leaked which was a worry for sure. The quality of the coffee is also really good considering the easy use and price of the product. No regrets buying this!
title: Average Product - No Serious Complaints

author: Elysia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: Bought this cause it was on sale and the reviews were amazing. I was not impressed. No fill line, you have to guess, the directions were not clear (said about 3/4s). For adding 16 teaspoons...it should be more potent...its not. It says its a coffee concentrate, but its not, or it should be much stronger. Very disappointed. I really cant believe how anyone could give it 5 stars.
title: Not a coffee concentrate

author: Abbie Hilborn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
review_content: I am a college student and I work full time so I live off coffee. Due to this I have very little time and money to spend on coffee. I found myself spending hundreds a month on Starbucks just because it's convenient but with this I am able to buy my favorite coffee grounds and prep my morning coffee in advance. Below I listed the main things I like about this cold brew system.-This system makes about 2-3 24oz cups of coffee.-it is very easy to disassemble and clean-it fits in a small space, doesn't take up much room in my small mini fridge-the coffee doesn't taste watered down, it is very flavorful even when using a light roast ground or adding creamer
title: Helps my mornings go a little more smoothly

author: Joshua
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021
review_content: I started drinking cold coffee a couple of years ago and quickly came to prefer it over hot coffee.  Then I found this.  I don't have to go buy cold coffee elsewhere now because I can make cold brew right at home!  It is super easy to use and the instructions are easy to understand.  Now I make my coffee at the beginning of the week and then just add whatever creamer or flavors I want to it when I make get it in the morning.  The only issue I had with this one is that it was a bit hard to clean as you cannot reach your hand in to scrub.  I found a silicon brush that works great for this purpose though and now I have absolutely no issues getting it clean.
title: Great for those that prefer cold coffee

author: Krysta Post
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: The only reason I took a star off is because this doesn't really hold much coffee. It's deceiving with the filter in the pitcher brewing up coffee but once it's done and I take out the filter and the water settles about half the container is already gone! So I'm having to pretty much brew a pitcher every day since my husband and I are both avid Iced Vanilla Latte drinkers. And keep in mind that latte's require almost half the drink to be milk! So I can't imagine how fast this would go if you're drinking just straight iced coffee. Since it takes 12-24 hours to brew it's a little bit of a pain. I'm seriously considering buying another one just so I can take a little bit of a break from brewing coffee daily!
title: Great!!

author: Kate Christensen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
review_content: What can I say about this handy little thing that’s hasn’t already been said? I got this for my partner to make cold brew coffee for them. On the prep side, I have no complaints. You pour the grounds in, pour the water in, give it a shake and leave it! (For those of you mad that it doesn’t soak all the grounds because the grounds float, the instructions literally say to shake it every few hours to make sure all the grounds are getting wet and infusing). From their (my partner, the consumer) side- it’s great. When the coffee filter is lifted out, it leaves the perfect amount of empty space in the pitcher to add cream and flavoring. It normally lasts them 2-3 days, so it’s not huge, but it’s really easy to use and I have no complaints, and either do they. ALSO- if you’re looking at the tea version of this, buy this version instead- the mesh is finer and does a better job of limiting little floaters of herbs.
title: Perfect Coffee, Read the instructions.

author: Hannah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
review_content: I get it, you need to put a lot of coffee to get a cold brew, and I thought that this would be an easy fix. I really didn't enjoy the product even though I saw all these rave reviews about it. I tried drinking coffee at home, and I'm very much more an iced coffee drinker than hot, but I don't buy my coffee in bulk, and after getting this, I used half of the ground coffee I buy for only like 2 days worth of coffee. Unfortunately, for me it wasn't worth it.
title: Too much coffee

author: Alex Theis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2016
review_content: This product makes decent cold brew. I like and it does its job. It's super easy to clean and looks attractive in the fridge. The price point is also very reasonable and it's compact size makes it versatile.There are a few flaws that should be pointed out before you buy it. First, it never utilizes all the coffee you put in it. The grounds float and so most of the time about 1/4 of them are still dry after 24-36 hours in the fridge. I've tried with different brands of coffee and different sized grounds. Same result.Next, the filter connects to the lid poorly. As you screw the lid on with the coffee-filled filter, the filter comes loose and you cannot tighten it. This doesn't seem to effect the final product, but it's clumsy.Finally, the instructions state that it makes concentrated coffee that you need to water down. This is NOT my experience. I add a tiny bit of water, but nowhere near what they suggest, unless you want coffee flavored iced tea. Again, I've tried different brands and grinds - same result.For the price, is it worth it? Yes. It does its job.
title: I like and it does its job

author: Israel Garibay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021
review_content: Not a very practical design for cleaning or using but it does give good tasting coffee.I gave up on it after a week of use because of how complicated it is to work with. This things has some serious design flaws -- I don't understand why the filter threads are so poor, the spigot poor's so poorly, how the coffee grounds always get into the coffee because of a poor seal of the filter -- this is just too much.I would not recommend this or gift this to a friend after my experience. I would like to see the manufacturer redesign this since the coffee actually takes quite good.
title: Designed Poorly, Yields Good Coffee

author: Honest Teej
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: I use it for Tea and Coffee and its pretty amazing. The filter looks pretty decent but there are two rubber rings that go inside to prevent leaking, they seem really cheap and probably wont last very long with constant open, closing and washing. I suggest buying extra if they sell it. Don't close the bottle using the handle on the side because its not that strong, use the handle on the lid. It fits nicely in the fridge door. The Cold Brew instructions say to lay it on its side overnight for the coffee so I tested that to see if it leaks and it worked great no leak. But I do suggest putting this on a lower shelf rather then the top for older fridges because I imagine if its too cold the water might freeze and expand and since this is air tight it might be bad. I suck at science though. Anyway great bottle!
title: Great Bottle

author: Emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
review_content: Super easy and fast to setup for brewing.  I have been using mine for over a year, and the filter is still not worn looking (which was an initial concern - how well would the filter hold up?). I let the coffee grounds dry a little in the filter, then tap them out easier then when they are still very wet. The filter cleans best for me with a spray nozzel. I liked this item so much I bought their larger version as well and use them both in rotation if I have company or for different strengths for different preferences or purposes.
title: Really like this item and it is the only coffee pot I use.

author: Justin

review_content: I absolutely love this brewer. Super simple to use and easy to clean.The only negative thing I would write is that the handle is a little flimsy. title: Finally found my daily drink!

author: Nina Laboy

review_content: This pitcher for cold brew is absolutely incredible. It’s affordable and effective. Keep in mind the center for the coffee grounds takes up about a 1/4 of the container. title: AMAZING!

author: SC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021
review_content: Awesome product that is BPA free. It's so easy to use to make cold brew tea and coffee. My cold brew are so strong and concentrated. Still one of my preferred pitcher/cold brew maker.

author: Crissy T

review_content: We go through alot of cold brew and it isn't cheap so when I saw this,  I knew I had to try it. The last picture is 3/4 full glass of cold brew with a little flavored creamer.If you like cold brew, definitely invest in this.
title: Why didn't I get this sooner!

author: blu7
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
review_content: Takeya dekuxe cold brewer has been a great buy! No more hot coffee, only to throw ice cubes or fridge it overnight. I bought the 2qt. & it about 3 cups. The pic.shows what i comsider to be 1 cup with the rest to be filled with milk, coconut water & other flavors. 🙂. author: Katelynn Walsh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
review_content: I really, really like this cold press maker. It's super easy to use and super easy to clean. It comes a part in three pieces and goes back together just as easy as it is to take it apart. I did notice that in order for all of the grounds to be used, pour water over the grounds before putting the cap on top and submerging in water. Otherwise the top of the grounds floats and doesn't get used. I can get about three drinks out of one batch and find that you don't need more than half of the filter filled with grounds to get a fantastic taste. This will help you save on grounds as well!
title: Absolutely LOVE

author: Jen Seay

title: Loved it so much I bought my mom one...

author: Courtney H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
review_content: I got the larger pitcher and it fits just right in the fridge,  easy to clean and quick to cold brew (12-24 hours). My very strong suggestion though is to remember to pull those grounds in that time frame because any longer on a medium coffee or stronger and you are going to be acting like it's 7am after an all night rager which is optimal depending on your level of caffeinated needs.  Brew smart,  my friends.
title: Easy, speedy, beautiful iced coffee

author: JW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_content: I used this for about 2 summers for cold brew coffee. There are some flaws. 1) if you don’t stir your coffee grounds in the filter after you’ve filled the pitcher with water, they might rest on top of the water instead of steeping in it, resulting in weak coffee and wasted grounds; 2) the pitcher is fairly easy to clean, but the threads on the lid and filter do occasionally need a deep clean or they get gunked up; 3) the filter will come apart in time no matter what you do, and then your cold brew will be filled with grounds; 4) it is single purpose. If you like cold coffee in the summer and hot coffee in the winter, you should get a French press and that will fill all your needs (plus, it is easier to make sure that all the grounds get saturated).
title: Made it through two summers, but it fell apart and I won’t be replacing it

author: Ben Sloboda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: I purchased this Takeya Cold Brew Iced Coffee Maker on a whim a few years ago.  I have never looked back.  It's a great product, and I even purchased a second so I could make two different coffees every few days.  I noticed that Jessica M. pointed out that when putting the grounds in the filter, the water causes them to float.  An additional fix for this is to invert the device (it is airtight and watertight) and swirl.  This usually gets all the grounds wet.  Here in New Zealand, the coffee is packaged in 200 gram bags.  The Takeya Cold Brew Iced Coffee Maker will hold 100 grams, so each bag is two full brews.  Always remember that the brewed coffee needs to be diluted with water, ice, and/or milk.  Drinking it straight makes my heart beat too fast, LOL!  There is another filter you can buy from Takeya to make iced tea, which uses different filter material (a wire mesh instead of silk cloth).  Be very careful cleaning it, as the silk filter material can easily be punctured (which renders the entire thing useless, as coffee grounds will seep into the brew).  The container is dishwasher safe on the top rack, which is perfect for cleaning (thought I recommend not putting the filter through the dishwasher, or rinsing it afterwards to remove any excess detergent).  I also just rinse between brews during the week and just run it through the dishwasher on the weekends.  That's it.  I just love this little guy, and it fits perfectly in the refrigerator door, or on the top shelf!  Thanks, Takeya!!  I will certainly buy again.
title: I absolutely love it

author: Angela Rosini
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
review_content: I hesitated to buy a cold brew maker because I wasn’t sure if it would taste all that good.  I’m addicted to Starbucks sweet cream cold brew, but I had to pull up on the reins with the amount of money I was spending. I tried cold brew at the grocery store, but I couldn’t seem to find one that didn’t have a soy sauce taste (just me?) I bought this one based on the amount of reviews.  This is good!!!  No soy sauce taste and it is so simple to use and clean.  Very happy with this purchase!  The carafe is small, so if you have many coffee drinkers, go with the larger one.
title: Finally a good cold brew!

author: Jalaena Rock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: This product works really well! Since we can’t leave our house I’ve been missing getting my iced coffee. I decided to buy this so I could make a simple iced coffee without dealing with a Keurig. I just used some cheap coffee grounds for now that I had and it worked really well! I could probably stretch it to give about 4-5 servings, but definitely not 8. I didn’t have any issues with any coffee grounds getting into the actual coffee. However, the spout is pretty bad and when you pour the coffee out of the pitcher and into a cup there will definitely be some spillage. But overall it’s a very simple and pretty low maintenance product & makes some great cold brew!
title: Perfect If You’re Missing Your Starbucks!

author: Monika
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021
review_content: I have a caffeine sensitivity (boo) but love the flavor of coffee and would still often drink it (to my dismay). A lot of places don’t make decaf cold brew. This way I’m able to make cold brew that is super flavorful despite using my starbucks decaf grounds. It’s nice to have a nice treat even if just chilling at home.
title: Perfect if you have to drink decaf!

author: A La Rose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2021
review_content: Overall, this is a great concept... I wish the pod wasn't attached to the top, but rather just arranged to hang in the pitcher so it can be easily removed (and water could be poured through it to ensure good grounds coverage). If you leave the pod in too long the coffee becomes extremely bitter... would recommend pulling out no more than 12 hours after initial filling.
title: I'm a Fan but Not Perfection

author: D West
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: I used to go to Starbucks every morning for my Venti Nitro cold brew. I don't like the fact that they don't use organic coffee so I decided I'd make my own cold brew, after all how hard could it be? Well, the hardest part is ordering it! 🤣 I fill it and let it sit overnight and then I continue to add water and shake each time for about three days. So basically the 14 Tablespoons it calls for I'm able to stretch 3-4 days!! Not only am I saving money, I'm not investing the pesticides anymore by using organic, and cold brew is less acidic which is better for us! I also drink alkaline water, so I fill it with that as well which makes it more acidic too.My morning coffee drink is delish! Creamy, frothy, chocolatey, a bit of cinnamon and sweetened with two scoops of L-Glycine. I add 1 scoop of Ancient Nutrition Chocolate Multi Collagen, Laird's mushrooms, and 1 cap full of MCT oil. 🙌🏼 So satisfying and so much better For me than Starbucks!
title: Under-Hyped! Superb and so easy! Money saver!

author: Sarah Smith

review_content: This is the first time I have ever written a product review for an Amazon product. That's how much I love this thing. author: Nate

author: Casey

author: Chelsea Solfest

review_content: Works great cold brew coffee. Easy to clean and maintain. title: Awesome morning routine addition

author: KB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
review_content: I bought this to make my morning cold brew as I really prefer them over hot coffee. Plus doing this at home greatly reduces your cost from buying coffee. It’s a small container and doesn’t take up a lot of room.I fill the filter up with about 8 teaspoons of grounds, I just eyeball it now. Then I hold it over the pitcher and pour 2 cups of water over it to settle the grounds. Then I add 8 more teaspoons and 2 more cups of water. I let it sit at least 24hrs, 36 or more is preferred. Comes out just how I like it.
title: Fabulous little cold brew maker

author: Melissa LaRose

review_content: The product works fine, I've made 3 batches with it. author: Mak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
review_content: Works well for the price. I had one previously that was another brand. It was glass and broke. The biggest reason I like this one is that it’s not glass, but does feel a bit more flimsy. It is very simple and easy to use, just put in ground coffee, water, let sit. This causes some of the coffee grounds to stay afloat above the water. I only noticed this when I went to dump the grounds and they were still dry.In short this is a good product for the price!

author: C.O.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: My husband has always loved coffee, especially cold brew, but I bought this cold brew pitcher because his coffee consumption at home has increased singificantly due to remote work. When we originally started making cold brew at home, it was messy and time consuming to use a series of bowls and strainers to remove the spent coffee grounds.This lightweight pitcher has no bells and whistles so to speak, but it does exactly what you want it to do with little fuss and hands-on time. You fill the filter with coffee, fill the pitcher 3/4 with water, shake well, and refrigerate. After the coffee has infused to your satisfaction, you take the lid off, remove the filter, and you have cold brew concentrate. You really only need minutes of hand-on time from start to finish.The filter is ultra-fine, so even if you are using a very finely ground coffee, it keeps everything out. (If the coffee is a very fine grind, a minimal amount of sediment may sink to the bottom, but it's easy to avoid.) The lid screws on tightly and truly is leak proof. I feel confident that we could take the pitcher of coffee with on a weekend trip.While I wish the pitcher was slightly larger, it is so easy to get a batch going that we don't mind making it a little more often. He's the only coffee drinker, and a pitcher has been lasting him several days. However, in a household with several, habitual coffee drinkers, this pitcher may prove to be too small on its own. But it's still so easy to use, so I'd just recommend getting a second pitcher.All in all, I recommend this product for anyone who loves cold brew and saving their valuable time.

author: Cesar Rodriguez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I am just now drinking my first batch and may change my review down the road. I used New England coffee, and steeped for about 20 hours. The brew's strength comes wholly from its flavor and NOT from any acidity. There is not a hint of acidity, which is an issue I face getting cold brew at some cafes. The blueberry notes from the grounds are expressed in a pleasant and creamy fragrance, and I am surprised by how much caffeine I am getting considering the weakly acidic profile.My complaints so far are centered on how much solid material diffuses into the water while brewing. I definitely surpassed the recommended brewing time of 12-18 hours, and did do regular shakes to strengthen the diffusion, so I will try single shakes and shorter brewing times to see how much this affects the smoothness of the brew at the expense of strength. This is by no means as bad as drip coffee, although the by-product seems to be more noticeable in this coffee than say in a cafe-bought coffee. I would attribute this to the filter quality, and am interested in seeing how the issue develops over time.For now, the pronounced flavor profile, strength, and low acidity merit 5 stars for me, especially at the cost and amount of money that I'll be saving (not to mention the flexibility I now have with picking my own grounds). Even if I only get a few dozen brews at this quality, I think it will have been worth the small investment.
